definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Aren't you afraid of being put into jail as the perpetrator?
sentences.chinese: 你就不怕被當做肇事者扔進班房嗎？

sentences.english: We do not know what led to the disaster nor who inflicted it.
sentences.chinese: 我們不知道災禍從何而起，也不知道肇事者是誰。

sentences.english: Agriculture is both culprit and victim when it comes to climate change.
sentences.chinese: 在氣候變化問題上，農業既是肇事者也是受害者。

sentences.english: I think there is always a duality of a victim within the instigator.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得肇事者在某一層面同時也是受害者。

definition: to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
to serve as forced labor/to take the rap for sb
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to report a case to the authorities
culpable driving causing serious damage or injury
to settle privately/to solve behind closed doors/to settle out of court
to surrender to the authorities/to turn oneself in (for a crime)
